intro: Merendera bulbocodium, commonly known as the bulbous merendera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients for growth. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management to prevent it from becoming invasive.
